thread.title: Nordstrom, El Pollo Loco, Applied Materials earnings in focus
thread.title_full: Nordstrom, El Pollo Loco, Applied Materials earnings in focus - MarketWatch

author: Sue Chang
title: Nordstrom, El Pollo Loco, Applied Materials earnings in focus
text:
Among the companies whose shares are expected to see active trade in Thursdayâ€™s session are Nordstrom Inc., El Pollo Loco Holdings Inc., and Applied Materials Inc.
Nordstrom JWN, -0.96% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 90 cents a share, according to a survey of analysts by FactSet. The department store company earned 95 cents a share a year earlier.
El Pollo Loco LOCO, -0.50% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of 18 cents a share, up from 16 cents a share a year ago.
Applied Materials AMAT, -0.23% is expected to post fiscal third-quarter earnings of 33 cents a share, up from 28 cents a share a year ago.
King Digital Entertainment PLC KING, -2.92% is likely to report second-quarter earnings of 42 cents a share, down from 59 cents a share a year ago.
Weibo Corp. WB, -3.99% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of a penny a share, improving from a loss of 8 cents a share a year ago.
Late Wednesday, Cisco Systems Inc. CSCO, -0.43% said its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings rose 3.2% to $2.32 billion, or 45 cents a share, while revenue grew to $12.84 billion from $12.36 billion. On an adjusted basis, the network equipment company earned 59 cents a share. Analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters had projected earnings of 56 cents a share on revenue of $12.65 billion.
News Corp NWS, +0.80% said it swung to a fiscal fourth-quarter net loss of $379 million on revenue of $2.14 billion. On an adjusted basis, News Corp earned 7 cents a share, ahead of the 5 cents a share forecast by analysts in a Thomson Reuters survey. The media conglomerate also said it would start paying a semiannual dividend of 10 cents a share. News Corp owns MarketWatch, the publisher of this report.
